name: NPR
text:
We get fed a lot of stories about sports as a path for upward social mobility. But the vast majority of sports offered at elite schools cater to mostly white, middle class kids. @OnlyAGameNPR
https://t.co/ffr1Xn1EEq

name: NPR
text: The revelation that Tucker Carlson's top writer had posted racist, sexist and homophobic sentiments online for years has led to renewed scrutiny of the Fox News host's own commentaries. Carlson is set to address the controversy Monday. https://t.co/kXGckPJCk4

name: NPR
text:
George Archer was a pro golfer for nearly 50 years. But it wasn't until after his death in 2005 that his secret was revealed: 

He had dyslexia — undiagnosed and untreated. @OnlyAGameNPR
https://t.co/qylfHvfAiF

name: NPR
text: Grammarians are up in arms over dictionaries including "irregardless." The Merriam-Webster dictionary responds: "We do not make the English language, we merely record it." https://t.co/gWfldI0Bka

name: NPR
text:
In 2007, U.S. Border Patrol officers detained 76 Indians at the U.S.-Mexico border. Last year, that number exceeded 7,600. 

U.S. and Indian officials have been trying to figure out why.
https://t.co/vY7rBObClV

name: NPR
text:
Rats are usually eager to help in a crisis, but that urge quickly disappears if they're in the company of passive bystanders, new research finds. 

That's very similar to how humans behave.  
 https://t.co/tg7X8GWWq3

name: NPR
text:
What makes a true apology? What does it mean to make amends for past mistakes? 

This @TedRadioHour: speakers explore how repairing the wrongs of the past is the first step toward healing for the future. https://t.co/dTPqeezuCP

name: NPR
text: In a fashion first, this season's couture collections were presented online. It was a chance to experiment — like Dior's painstakingly crafted mini collection, displayed on dolls rather than models. https://t.co/IuDECeJShB

name: NPR
text:
A historian stumbled upon newspaper columns written by Lou Gehrig in 1927. They reveal a side of the former Yankees player that few saw. @OnlyAGameNPR 
https://t.co/LnmIxyacG1

name: NPR
text:
Jameela Jamil arrived in LA, went on one audition, booked the job and became a star on the sit-com "The Good Place" — a totally typical, not at all out of the ordinary Hollywood story!

Hear her get quizzed on @waitwait.
 https://t.co/0ldW7pT935

name: NPR
text:
Review: An outbreak story released amid a pandemic, "Survivor Song" feels (depressingly) like it might've been a non-fiction story if things today and yesterday had gone just a little bit differently than they did.

Plus zombies.
https://t.co/35PJTuIMLK

name: NPR
text:
More than 1,000 employees at the CDC have signed a letter calling for the agency to address "ongoing and recurring acts of racism and discrimination" against Black employees.

It also calls for the CDC to declare racism a public health crisis in the U.S.
https://t.co/Sv7EXzjFuh

name: NPR
text:
An NPR analysis finds that at least 65,000 absentee or mail-in ballots have been rejected this year because they arrived past deadline—often through no fault of the voter.

And while it's a relatively small number, they could prove crucial in a close race.
https://t.co/9j66byT0YG

name: NPR
text: Just in: Washington, D.C.'s NFL team has announced it is officially retiring its name and logo — which is widely vi… https://t.co/Lr2WwfNOwG

name: NPR
text:
The team has not announced what the new name would be. It said team owner Dan Snyder and head coach Ron Rivera are working together to develop a new name.
https://t.co/gXWJv6jFJg

name: NPR
text:
To take control of the Senate, Democrats will need to net three seats in November if Joe Biden wins, and four if President Trump is reelected.

That once looked nearly unachievable. Now, it's becoming a real possibility.
https://t.co/tXJur9SVKU

name: NPR
text:
Poland's conservative president Andrjez Duda has narrowly won reelection — further calling into question the country's commitment to western-style democracy.

The ruling party has worked to weaken the country's independent judiciary and free press.
https://t.co/q3m4lG7hD5
